intro: Pentodon decumbens, commonly known as the creeping pentodon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with hairy stems and showy yellow flowers. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, often with serrated edges. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
